item.title: Yours Wants to Take Bitcoin Mainstream by Targeting Non-Bitcoin Communities
item.description:
Yours Wants to Take Bitcoin Mainstream by Targeting Non-Bitcoin Communities

Former Reddit Cryptocurrency Engineer, Ryan X. Charles , is currently working on a new, bitcoin-powered social network, but he isn't focused on creating something that will only be used by the Bitcoin community. In a recent interview on Epicenter Bitcoin , Charles noted that creating an app used by a mainstream audience would have much more value than simply creating /r/Bitcoin with micropayments.

item.title: Hyperledger Blockchain Project Adds 17 New Members - CoinDesk
item.description:
Hyperledger Blockchain Project Adds 17 New Members - CoinDesk

An affiliate of global electronics giant Samsung is among 17 new members to join the Hyperledger blockchain project. The Linux-led blockchain initiative today announced new companies and organizations have joined its ranks including Samsung's IT services subsidiary Samsung SDS, Quickbooks developer Intuit and heavy machinery manufacturer Sany.

item.title: Former CIA Analyst Says Terrorists Utilize Bitcoin to Boost Funding
item.description:
Former CIA Analyst Says Terrorists Utilize Bitcoin to Boost Funding

A former counterterrorism analyst for the CIA has found that terrorists are utilizing innovative technologies to boost their funding, one of which is through the use of bitcoin. Yaya Fanusie is the director of analysis for the Foundation for Defense of Democracies' Center on Sanctions and Illicit Finance (CSIF) who previously spent seven years as both an economic and counterterrorism analyst in the CIA.

Former Reddit Cryptocurrency Engineer, Ryan X. Charles, is currently working on a new, bitcoin-powered social network, but he isn't focused on creating something that will only be used by the Bitcoin community. item.title: 33% of all bitcoin exchanges operational during | HodlHodl news
item.description:
33% of all bitcoin exchanges operational during | HodlHodl news

New data disclosed to Reuters shows a third of bitcoin trading platforms have been hacked, and nearly half have closed in the half dozen years since they burst on the scene. Tyler Moore, assistant professor of cyber security at the University of Tulsa's Tandy School of Computer Science will soon publish the new research on the vulnerability of bitcoin exchanges.

item.title: Onchain Scaling Conference: Are Hard Forks Really Necessary?
item.description:
Onchain Scaling Conference: Are Hard Forks Really Necessary?

Today, the Encore Edition of the Also read: The Bitcoin Blocksize Debate Has Not Even Fully Begun Yet Onchain Scaling conference took place, discussing the many on-chain scalability solutions on the table for Bitcoin. Developer Jeff Garzik, Cornell professor Emin GÃ¼n Sirer, and lawyer Andrew Hinkes discussed hard fork potentials and the legal aspects of managing the blockchain protocol on-chain.

item.title: BIP 65 - how standard is it?
item.description:
BIP 65 - how standard is it?

I read in this great thread that which BIP are standards is not always obvious. What about BIP 65? To which extent is it standard? Currently, all I know is that "Miners following the developers o...

item.title: ZapChain Announces the Impending Closure of Its Social Platform - NEWSBTC
item.description:
ZapChain Announces the Impending Closure of Its Social Platform - NEWSBTC

Zapchain becomes the latest Bitcoin-based startup to close its doors. Read more... ZapChain, the Bitcoin-based content sharing and tipping platform is soon going to shut down. The Reddit like social media platform focused on Bitcoin and cryptocurrency technology has announced its impending demise on its user's timelines.

item.title: Keza App Relaunched, Enabling Bitcoin Investing In U.S. Stocks
item.description:
Keza App Relaunched, Enabling Bitcoin Investing In U.S. Stocks

Satoshi Citadel Industries (SCI) has acquired the bitcoin-powered Keza app which allows users to invest in mainstream U.S. stocks, and has relaunched it. The Keza app closed in April shortly after launching, CCN reported. The project had received $357,000 in funding backed by Digital Currency Group and Jason Calacanis of HOF Capital.

item.title: MIT Fintech Report Suggests the End of Banking Is Near
item.description:
MIT Fintech Report Suggests the End of Banking Is Near

A new report, issued by the Also read: Bitcoin IRA Gives Away Free Silver to Celebrate $500K Milestone Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), explores the potential of digital banking, including the possibility of a world without banks. The . report , contentiously titled "Digital Banking Manifesto: The End of Banks?"
